snippet: Several of the city’s most strained institutions are partially or completely uninsured, state records show, lacking what is seen as a standard safeguard across the country.
abstract: Several New York City hospitals are partially or completely uninsured for malpractice, forgoing what is considered a standard safeguard across the country; executives of these hospitals, most of which are in poor neighborhoods, say their dire financial circumstances and high malpractice premiums make it impractical to pay millions of dollars a year for insurance; insurance experts say decision to do without malpractice coverage is shortsighted.
lead_paragraph: Several of the city’s most strained institutions are partially or completely uninsured, state records show, lacking what is seen as a standard safeguard across the country.

headline.seo: Some Hospitals in New York Lack a Malpractice Safety Net
headline.main: Troubled New York Hospitals Forgo Coverage for Malpractice
headline.print_headline: Some Hospitals in New York Lack a Malpractice Safety Net
